name: Risk Prediction Fundamentals
description: Key concepts in risk prediction, statistical modeling, and decision science.

cards.title: Monte Carlo Simulation
cards.description: A statistical technique that uses random sampling to model the probability of different outcomes in an uncertain process.
bulletpoints: Use repeated random sampling to estimate probabilities in complex systems
Model risk in finance, engineering, cybersecurity, and logistics
Simulate a wide range of scenarios to test decision-making under uncertainty
cards.summaryText: Run Monte Carlo simulations to quantify outcome probabilities across uncertain scenarios.

cards.title: Bayesian Networks
cards.description: A probabilistic graphical model that represents relationships between variables for decision-making under uncertainty.
bulletpoints: Use conditional probabilities to model dependencies between risk factors
Improve decision-making in security, finance, and artificial intelligence
Analyze risk scenarios where complete data is unavailable
cards.summaryText: Build Bayesian networks to infer risk relationships even when data is sparse.

cards.title: Anomaly Detection
cards.description: A method for identifying unusual patterns or outliers that do not conform to expected behavior.
bulletpoints: Detect fraud, cyberattacks, and insider threats through pattern analysis
Use machine learning to identify deviations from normal behavior
Analyze financial transactions and network traffic for risk management
cards.summaryText: Deploy anomaly detection to surface outliers that signal fraud or intrusions early.

cards.title: Game Theory
cards.description: A mathematical framework for modeling competitive and strategic interactions where each participant's outcome depends on others' choices.
bulletpoints: Model conflict and cooperation in competitive environments
Apply strategic decision-making to cybersecurity and military tactics
Understand how rational actors make choices under risk and uncertainty
cards.summaryText: Use game-theory models to anticipate strategic moves in risk-laden contests.

cards.title: Nash Equilibrium
cards.description: A game theory concept where no player has an incentive to change their strategy given the choices of others.
bulletpoints: Analyze stable decision points in competitive environments
Use in economics, security planning, and negotiation strategies
Predict outcomes in adversarial situations, such as cyberwarfare or financial markets
cards.summaryText: Identify Nash equilibria to locate stable strategies where no actor gains by shifting.

cards.title: Agent-Based Modeling
cards.description: A computational modeling approach that simulates interactions between autonomous agents to analyze complex systems.
bulletpoints: Simulate crowd behavior, economic trends, and supply chain disruptions
Use artificial intelligence to model real-world decision-making
Analyze emergent behaviors in large-scale risk scenarios
cards.summaryText: Simulate autonomous agents to observe emergent risk patterns in complex systems.

cards.title: Black Swan Events
cards.description: Rare, high-impact events that are difficult to predict but often rationalized in hindsight.
bulletpoints: Recognize unpredictable risks in geopolitics, markets, and technology
Develop resilience strategies to minimize catastrophic impacts
Analyze historical Black Swan events for better preparedness
cards.summaryText: Plan resilience around rare, high-impact shocks that defy conventional prediction.

cards.title: Fuzzy Logic
cards.description: A computational method that deals with uncertainty by allowing values between absolute true and false states.
bulletpoints: Handle ambiguity in decision-making processes
Apply in artificial intelligence, control systems, and risk assessments
Improve decision models when exact probabilities are unknown
cards.summaryText: Apply fuzzy logic to reason through ambiguous inputs where crisp probabilities fail.

cards.title: Big Data Analytics
cards.description: The process of analyzing vast datasets to uncover hidden patterns, correlations, and trends for decision-making.
bulletpoints: Use AI-driven analytics for predictive modeling in risk management
Process structured and unstructured data to detect security threats
Improve business intelligence and real-time risk assessment
cards.summaryText: Leverage big data analytics to uncover patterns and power predictive risk models.
